name: Peach Tree Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Peach Tree Inn for 1 night on our drive from San Francisco to Los Angeles. The view from the hotel is fantastic. The staff at the main desk were lovely, extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel has all of the basic amenities for a comfortable stay, and it was nice to have breakfast in a homely breakfast room. Although there wasn't a vast selection for breakfast, it did the job. If you're looking for luxury, then this isn't the hotel for you, since as others have noted, it is quite small and dated. If you are however looking for a simple, budget friendly motel for a short stop over then I highly recommend this place.
reviews.title: Good hotel for a 1 night stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: San Luis Obispo is a very quaint town and there are some wonderful restaurants on the main street.
reviews.title: Lovely, classic motel with great family feel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: San Luis is a gorgeous, quite studenty town and the Peach Tree is a great place for a short stay. Classic motel style, with a real family feel - owners and other guests were super friendly and we shared some good conversation with other guests. The rooms were spotlessly clean and the homemade strawberry lemonade was a great addition. Much nicer than a faceless chain place - would recommend.
reviews.title: Mostly good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for only one night. The facility is old and dated but clean and the staff was very helpful. It has an old timer charm to it and apparently has been a repeat destination for many over the years. The breakfast was good too.
reviews.title: Needs updating and a good deep clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint was more a puzzling annoyance concerning the window unit a/c in our room. When the window drape is drawn closed it completely covers the a/c unit and blocks the cool air from entering the room??? I ended up having to partially disassemble the drape and tie it up with stick pins just to get some air flow while still maintaining some semblance of privacy within our room. Strange indeed.
reviews.title: Superb!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at San Luis Obispo at around 8.30pm. We were travelling from SFO to Anaheim. We checked in very easily and had a very pleasant room. It was a great size with a cute balcony over the creek. The peach tree is lovely in the middle of the parking lot.
reviews.title: Great stop over. Reasonably priced and a great breakfast. Very cute place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: Breakfast was a feast. The bathroon is a little outdated and a was not spic and span, but you can get over that. The rest of the room was spotless.
reviews.title: Its fine to be honest. Nothing...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Its fine to be honest. Nothing particularly special but for price is fantastic value. Couple of things - the service was polite but not quite the family vibe we were expecting. Breakfast was good but not amazing. Again given the reviews I expected more.
reviews.title: Cosy family run inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: That said as a value package it cannot be beaten. Good location with the trolley into town and slo itself is good fun.
reviews.title: Exteremely friendly + family run = pleasure to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: We were greeted very friendly with a glass of fresh strawberry lemonade. The room on the creek was simple but clean and tidy with a lovely kingsize bed. It had a patio towards the creek. The breakfast was generous and very good.
reviews.title: An excellent stop over, with friendly...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for three nights while in town for a friend's wedding. Went to school in SLO and have stayed in multiple inns/motels and this one is fairly priced for what you get. The quality of the Peach Tree is comparable to other in its price range. Parking is great, as each room has a spot virtually right out front. Stayed in a king room in the older part of the inn. Old and outdated decor but that's no big deal for me. Found the room to be dark unless you drew the curtains. Bathroom was very modest but larger than some chain hotels I've stayed in. The bathroom was very well lit. The entire room was clean and serviced promptly every day. I found the bed to be very comfortable and slept well every night. The wall heater was not working when we were there which was fine because it was a hot weekend, but it would clearly need attention in the winter. We paid $129/night with a buy 2, get 3 nights free promotion, so we effectively paid $86/night. The Peach Tree completely met my expectations for a motel in this price range. It also offered a complementary breakfast which I was completely satisfied with. It offered muffins, cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit, hard boiled eggs and coffee/tea. Cookies and snacks were offered throughout the day which was very nice. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Very Comfortable Modest Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Can only concur with most previous reviews: Peach Tree Inn is a traditional (i.e., older), locally owned motel; well-maintained and fairly priced by California standards; management is friendly and forthcoming and provides a good assortment of VHS tapes for those who can't abide what's usually on television. Rooms are compact but quiet, bathrooms a little dated, and closing the drapes also closes off the air-conditioner; but overall my stay was comfortable and I would certainly return - especially if I have a car next time, for when the shuttle is not running, it's a fairly long walk to the attractive heart of town down by the old mission.
reviews.title: Lived up to its reputation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: First, this is not an "inn". It is just a mid-range motel. And it is not a peach tree in the parking area, but some sort of acacia.
reviews.title: Desillusion!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are ok, but with stuffy decor and very dim lights. We had one of the "best" rooms with a king sized bed, which my friend and I shared, as there are no twin beds. I would say it was acceptable.
reviews.title: Well worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: The bathroom is small and not very convenient. The breakfast was not bad, with a fair choice of foods [the blueberry muffins, though, were terrible]. Management is friendly, but when asked about dinner recommendations, could only give directions to more or less fast food places.
reviews.title: Darling with good value!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We're a family of 4 from Australia who stayed at Peach Tree Inn for 3 nights as part of a 2 week holiday in California. We were travelling by public transport (i.e., we did not drive). The Inn is a short cab drive to and from the lovely Amtrak station and an easy walk from town. Staff are so helpful and friendly and the included generous buffet breakfasts are great! Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Friendly caring staff, great location and excellent value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were so pleased with this hotel. Quiet, small rooms, great beds, convenient location, ample parking, helpful and friendly staff, clean, clean, clean.
reviews.title: We loved this place and would love to stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: The complimentary continental breakfast the next day was quite a surprise, with fresh local strawberries, oatmeal, San Luis Sour Dough bread (with toaster), cereals, muffins, breads and my husband's favorite, hard boiled eggs.
reviews.title: Now this is personal service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: All of this for $79 and no hidden fees. We woke up to a cool, moist fresh morning that was quiet and peaceful. I would love to stay here again. They even offered free computer access in the breakfast room so that I could check on some other reservations.
reviews.title: Great room, price, breakfast and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been staying at the Peach Tree for a few years now whenever I need to stay in San Luis Obispo. I keep coming back because the place is great. The staff is very friendly and courteous and you get personalized service.
reviews.title: A Motel with Fresh Fruit - Why Not Give it a Try and Save $$

aka: Peach Tree Hotel San Luis Obispo
description: The Peach Tree Inn is a home-style inn centrally located in friendly San Luis Obispo. Our caring front desk staff know San Luis Obispo well and are eager to assist you in making your stay most enjoyable.Located on the edge of town, our Inn allows visitors the ability to carry on business-as-usual, or to escape from the hurried world to relax on the porch, gaze at the hillside and chat with interesting travelers.
